ygData.subject: RE: Power Leveling Trainer
ygData.msgSnippet: You are right.  Problem is that more than half of the pple hunting in Lake are casters, and that 2 solo spots are HOT favourite hunting ground for all casters.
ygData.messageBody:
You are right. Problem is that more than half of the pple hunting in Lake
are casters, and that 2 solo spots are HOT favourite hunting ground for all
casters. Chances is very high that there are wiz at these spots (since wiz
kick ass in such FFA situation), which you will have no fight when playing
FFA with them. ;)

For me, I start to solo in 2 birds isle at lvl 24, by spreading out the
spawn. But if anytime when there is other pple come in, I will still lost
1 of the bird coz my mana cant generate fast enuff to take the 2nd. My
favourite spots are still the the solo isle, coz I basically dun like to
fight with others for kill. At solo isle, thing are very clear cut, if u
can win my nuke over FFA, u get the kill, I leave, if not, u better leave
;)

Btw, aviak guards can resis spell pretty well sometimes, I ever get spells
resisted 4-5 times when fighting few green chick. Even if I can root them
in the 1st place, chances is tat they will break free b4 my 3rd nuke. So
far I need to root average 1.5 times per fight, due to the resist or
break-free. If the 2nd bird come back after ya fear effect gone, good luck
to u (and the zone is quite far from all the aviaks guard spawning spot
except the one outside arena, where it's usually crowded), hehe.

Basically the hunting at Lake is quite boring, but UO players who used to
macroing shld have no problem (ah, remind me the days when I macro b4 I
sleep, wait up 2am to off PC for server down, wake up 3.30am again to turn
on PC con't macroing, hehe). But becoz of the slow spawn, the most impt
thing is to survive to maintain the xp earned. I know a warrior who got
killed in lake, swim to loot his corpse and got killed by the frog prince
(lvl 30 plus, con red to me still and very AGRO in sea) when he is swimng,
hehe. A lvl 29 necro was also killed last night at zone by the undead
trains (by a lvl 22 warrior), hehe.

Ziltus

On Friday, 06 August, 1999 9:43 AM, Cheng Shan Chieh, Freddy [SMTP:scche
ng@...] wrote:
> From: "Cheng Shan Chieh, Freddy" <sccheng@...>
>
> As far as i can remember from those necro boards, necros (cant remember
> which level) can solo a 2 bird site all by himself... using the following
> technique...
> 1. send pet to one...
> 2. cast DOT...
> 3. cast fear on another...
> 4. kill one as fast as possible...
> 5. then kill the other when it comes back...
>
> after level 20... necros get a spell call allure of death that allows us
to
> convert HP to mana and since our Siphon Life spells can damage n heal
> ourselves... this technique somewat works - as i believe...
>
> have yet to try... n personally i think i will try a 1 bird and test out
its
> ability b4 i try the 2 bird site...
>
> Nicademous
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: LKW <leekw13@...>
> To: <sg-everquest@onelist.com>
> Sent: Friday, August 06, 1999 10:16 AM
> Subject: [sg-everquest] Power Leveling Trainer
>
>
> > From: LKW <leekw13@...>
> >
> > No doubt my current Wiz is of low INT amg all other casters, but he
seem
> to
> > solo pretty well. Normally I use root and nuke (with my most powerful
> > spell) tactics. But when the mob resist my root for the 2nd time, I
will
> > switch to melee and nuke (with my 2nd most powerful spell, 40% less
dam,
> > 40% less mana but cast much faster). And surprisingly, I still managed
to
> > survive in Lake Rathetear using these 2 method till now. ;)
> >
> > For those who are pondering between lvl 20 to 24 who cant still solo a
> > aviak guard now, I offer FOC Power-Leveling-Training sessions in Lake
;)
> > I've helped Deadflower and Flyingfox to lvl few times using this
method,
> > and will be willing to help all others local kakis if u need my
training
> > sessions. Basically we will go to the 2-birds isle and try to spread
the
> > spawning of the aviak guards one after another instead of both at the
same
> > time. The trainee will solo the bird, and I will monitor both HP.
Once
> > mob HP drop to below 50%, I will start nuking it to death. In this way,
> the
> > trainee can solo safely. At lvl 26, some of the green chicks still
give
> me
> > xp, and best of all, no faction hit. Come to think of it, Lake loot in
> > term of money is not bad. With one night hunting, I normally get ard
> > 20pp-30pp (but also spend alot buying my leather skin reagent, 5gp plus
> per
> > cast, one night can spend 10-20pp), that's after I sell all the rusty
and
> > bronze weaps.
> >
> > The only condition is that if there is any aviak guard con blue to me,
I
> > will get it. Reason is becoz 50% of the green chick no more giving me
xp,
> > whereas they still con blue to the trainee. Of coz sometime when blue
> bird
> > spawn 3 in a row and I'm oom after the 2nd bird, trainee can get it.
> > Trainee also get to hunt all those bird con green to me, which more
than
> > 50% of the time con blue to them (if u r below lvl 22, no bird will be
con
> > green to u, hehe).
> >
> > I'm not sure how long further can the Lake give my xp, esp when I reach
> lvl
> > 27. If birds still give me xp at lvl 27, I will stay there and offer
> > training sessions, if not I will go elsewhere.
> >
> > Btw, during the training session, we dun hunt in group. Instead we
hunt
> > solo so tat trainee can get ALL the xp. Based on my past experience,
> > killing 2 birds in a group of 2 will give less xp killing 1 bird by
solo.
> > I still believe in this principle. For those magi/necro out there, we
> > have confirm with GM that pet is treated as one of ya team member even
if
> u
> > are soloing. Basically pet will eat the summoner's xp regardless if it
> > kill the mob or not. They say mob only eat xp from other group members
if
> > it kill the mob, this I'm not sure but it definitely will eat the
summoner
> > xp. When I train FF, I will ask him to dismiss pet so tat he can get
all
> > the xp. EQ is quite balance - with pet u can hunt tougher mob with
better
> > loot, but u will get less xp ;)
> >
> > Ziltus, the PLT (Power Leveling Trainer)
> >

[SMTP:drizzt@...]
> > wrote:

might

thou' I

a

-
> > you
> > > >are the worst life form in EQ, just like a PCB recruit in army, you
are
> > > >worse than chicken backside blah blah blah! Argh!
> > > >Furthermore I haven't find any good stuff for my Zil yet, where got
> time
> > to
> > > >find good item to start my new wiz off? ;(
> > > >
> > > >On the other hand, I'm also very uncertain as too which race to
choose
> > for
> > > >my new wiz. Personally I hate to been KOS as a DE, hate to be so
short
> > > >(ugly) and short-sighted as a gnome, hate to have night blindness as
a
> > > >erudite (ok halo of light may help but my erudite wiz friend still
half
> > > >blind at night, esp in place with fog), hate to be so weak (low STR
of
> > 55)
> > > >as a HE and hate to be a half-f**k wiz as a human (average stats
plus
> > night
> > > >blindness).
> > > >
> > > >Amg all, I love the DEX/AGI stats of gnome, the look and height of
HE,
> > the
> > > >INT of Erudite, and the no xp penalty of human. U tell me which to
> > choose
> > > >lor, hehe.
> > > >
> > > >If I were to start a new wiz in Innoruuk, anyone wanna hunt with me?
;)
